nodes.text: Tsiraki was a blue colored alcoholic beverage crafted from fermented salakberries and pickling spices. It was consumable by humans and Zabraks, and could cause intoxication. The drink could be stored in bottles or served in tall, purple tinted glasses. Tsiraki was served at the bar of the nightclub Outlander Club on the planet Coruscant in 22 BBY.

In 5 ABY, tsiraki was served to former Imperial loyalty officer Sinjir Rath Velus in a Junari Point bar on the planet Chandrila. Drinking it caused him to pass out and wake up with an unsteady head. He described tsiraki as both sour and sweet, and had mixed feelings on whether it was good or bad. Bounty hunter Jas Emari, one of his teammates, insisted that it tasted like slug bile. Days later, Velus attended a meeting with his team and lamented that he had forgotten to bring a bottle of tsiraki.

Tsiraki first appeared in Aftermath: Life Debt, a 2016 canon novel written by Chuck Wendig. The drink was first pictured in the 2019 reference book Star Wars: How Not to Get Eaten by Ewoks and Other Galactic Survival Skills by Christian Blauvelt. How Not to Get Eaten by Ewoks and Other Galactic Survival Skills revealed that tsiraki was among the beverages included in the set for the Outlander Club bar in the 2002 prequel trilogy film Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones, although the drink was not visible on screen in the film itself.
